page.title: 13WILBERFOSS DRAINAGE/LITTER
page.content: In the past 6 years the village has been flooded on 4 occasions. In order to prevent this in the future the beck is being widened and an overflow channel is being dug to carry away excess water. The cost in 1985 will be $7,000. There has been much argument and many meetings with the local land drainage board about the proposed im- provements, as some people would have lost large parts of their gardens. This has now been settled. LITTER. In the village there are only three litter bins to be found. In a survey it was found that the commonest type of litter was plastic wrappings and containers. Empty drink cans were the next most common. Plastic litter is a big problem as it does not rot away and blows all over the place in the wind, making it difficult to clear up.It is a hazard to farm animals too.
